Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: 女の人
Entry.EnglishText: Woman

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Eugene>
Entry.EnglishText: <Eugene>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Claire>
Entry.EnglishText: <Claire>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Tytree>
Entry.EnglishText: <Tytree>

Entry.JapaneseText: 女の子
Entry.EnglishText: Girl

Entry.JapaneseText: 男の子
Entry.EnglishText: Boy

Entry.JapaneseText: おじいさん
Entry.EnglishText: Old Man

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: キョグエン
Entry.EnglishText: Kyogen

Entry.JapaneseText: キョグエン
Entry.EnglishText: Kyogen

Entry.JapaneseText: 宿屋・食材屋
Entry.EnglishText: Inn - Grocery Store

Entry.JapaneseText: ああ、みなさん…… ご無事だったんですね。
Entry.EnglishText: Oh, it's you guys... It's good to see you're all safe.

Entry.JapaneseText: ああ、クレアも助ける事ができた。
Entry.EnglishText: Yeah, we were able to save Claire as well.

Entry.JapaneseText: 隣の部屋に捕まっていた子は？
Entry.EnglishText: What about the girl in the other room?

Entry.JapaneseText: 捕えられていたのは、 クレアひとりだったみたいだ。
Entry.EnglishText: It seems like they only took Claire.

Entry.JapaneseText: え？ じゃあ…… 自分で逃げたのかしら……
Entry.EnglishText: Huh? Well, I wonder if she escaped on her own...

Entry.JapaneseText: きっとそうだろう。
Entry.EnglishText: That must be the case, I'm sure of it.

Entry.JapaneseText: クレアさんも 無事だったみたいでよかったです。 それじゃあ私、これで……
Entry.EnglishText: I'm glad to hear that Claire is safe now, too. Well then, I should be going...

Entry.JapaneseText: うむ、気をつけて行くんだ。 誰か同じ方面に行く者がいたら、 ついていった方がいい。
Entry.EnglishText: Yes, and be careful. If you can find someone who's heading in the same direction, it would be best to travel alongside them.

Entry.JapaneseText: ええ、そうします。 色々ありがとう……
Entry.EnglishText: All right, I'll do that. Thank you for everything.

Entry.JapaneseText: あとはフランツさんだな。
Entry.EnglishText: Now we just need to speak to Franz.

Entry.JapaneseText: どうした？
Entry.EnglishText: What's wrong?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……<Veigue>、私……
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>, I...

Entry.JapaneseText: いえ……
Entry.EnglishText: ...Never mind.

Entry.JapaneseText: ま、とにかく行こうぜ。
Entry.EnglishText: Anyway, we'd better get a move on.

Entry.JapaneseText: この世でいちばん 大切なものはお金……！
Entry.EnglishText: The most important thing in this world is money!

Entry.JapaneseText: ……って、ワン・ギン様が 言ってたよ。
Entry.EnglishText: ...is what Mr. Wan Gin said.

Entry.JapaneseText: あ、ワン・ギン様っていうのは、 この街で一番エライ人ね。
Entry.EnglishText: Oh, Mr. Wan Gin is the most important person in town.

Entry.JapaneseText: 旅の人を探してるんなら、 宿屋にいるかもしれないね。 宿屋はすぐそこの建物よ。
Entry.EnglishText: If you're looking for travelers, you might find them at the inn. The inn's that building over there.

Entry.JapaneseText: ワン・ギン様はすごい人だけど、 敵も多いのよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Mr. Wan Gin is an amazing person, but he has a lot of enemies.

Entry.JapaneseText: でも、みんな面と向かって 悪口とか言えないみたい。
Entry.EnglishText: Though, it seems like no one would dare say that to his face.

Entry.JapaneseText: お金を使って、 色々仕返しされちゃうから。
Entry.EnglishText: Because he's gonna use his money to pay them back.

Entry.JapaneseText: 早くオークションに 参加できるようになりたいなあ……
Entry.EnglishText: I wish I could get to participate in the auction immediately...

Entry.JapaneseText: オークションに参加できるように なったら、出品された ステキなドレスを買うのよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Once I'm old enough to join the auction, I'll buy a pretty dress to wear.

Entry.JapaneseText: 裕福な街だから、 盗賊たちは四六時中、 この街を狙ってるのよね。
Entry.EnglishText: Bandits constantly attack this town because everyone here is really rich.

Entry.JapaneseText: でも少しくらい盗られたって、 本当はワン・ギン様は 痛くもかゆくもないらしいわ。
Entry.EnglishText: But Mr. Wan Gin doesn't bat an eye no matter how much they steal.

Entry.JapaneseText: 盗賊に襲われたけど、 ワン・ギン様は痛くもかゆくも なかったんだって。
Entry.EnglishText: Those bandits attacked the village, but Mr. Wan Gin said he doesn't care.

Entry.JapaneseText: やっぱりお金があるって ステキよね！
Entry.EnglishText: Being rich really is wonderful, isn't it?

Entry.JapaneseText: ベルサスにアガーテ様が来て みんなの前でお話したんだって。
Entry.EnglishText: Everyone has been saying that Lady Agarte came to Belsas.

Entry.JapaneseText: アガーテ様って、 お金持ちなのかな？
Entry.EnglishText: Is Lady Agarte rich?

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマとかヒューマとか みんな、種族の事が気になって、 それで争ってるんだって。
Entry.EnglishText: Be it Gajuma or Huma, everyone's concious about race and they keep fighting over it.

Entry.JapaneseText: 私は、お金持ちかどうかしか 気にならないけどなぁ。
Entry.EnglishText: As for me, I only care if I'm rich or not.

Entry.JapaneseText: この音、うるさいけど、 そのうちワン・ギン様が お金を使って止めてくれるわ。
Entry.EnglishText: This sound really is noisy. I wish Mr. Wan Gin would pay the noise to shut up.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……バイラスって、お金持ちも そうじゃない人も襲うの？ どうして……？
Entry.EnglishText: Why do Biruses attack both the rich and the poor...?

Entry.JapaneseText: 私、お金持ちの男の人と ケッコンしたいんだぁ。
Entry.EnglishText: I want to marry a rich man someday.

Entry.JapaneseText: 物知りじいさんの話って マユツバばかりなんだってさ。
Entry.EnglishText: That wise old man keeps telling dubious tales.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……マユツバって…… うまいのか？
Entry.EnglishText: What's "dubious?" Is it tasty?

Entry.JapaneseText: <Cyan>幻の庭<White>って何？ うまいものがたくさん置いてる 食堂の名前？
Entry.EnglishText: What's a <Cyan>Garden of Illusions<White>? Is that the name of a tavern with tasty food?

Entry.JapaneseText: みんな、 ワン・ギン様には 頭が上がらないんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: Nobody can go against Wan Gin.

Entry.JapaneseText: だって、この街で 一番エライ人なんだもん。
Entry.EnglishText: Because he's this town's most important person.

Entry.JapaneseText: オークションには 子供は入れないんだってさ。
Entry.EnglishText: Children aren't allowed at the auction.

Entry.JapaneseText: どんなご馳走が出てくるんだろ？ 早く大人になりたいな……
Entry.EnglishText: I wonder what tasty food they serve there? I want to get older now...

Entry.JapaneseText: 盗賊たちはボクたちが 逆らったりしなければ、 命まで取る事はないんだって。
Entry.EnglishText: The bandits won't kill us if we don't fight back.

Entry.JapaneseText: 大人たちが そう言ってたよ。
Entry.EnglishText: That's what the adults told us.

Entry.JapaneseText: 盗賊ってお金がないから おそって来るんでしょ？
Entry.EnglishText: They attack this village because they're poor, right?

Entry.JapaneseText: だったら、みんなでお金を あげればいいのにね。
Entry.EnglishText: I think it would be better if everyone gave all their money to them.

Entry.JapaneseText: ボク、アガーテ様に会いたいな！ ベルサスに来たんだってさ！
Entry.EnglishText: I want to meet Lady Agarte! I heard she went to Belsas!

Entry.JapaneseText: いくらあげたらキョグエンにも 来てくれるのかなぁ？
Entry.EnglishText: How much do I have to pay her so that she'll come here to Kyogen?

Entry.JapaneseText: キョグエンはお金があるから、 みんな争わないんだってさ。
Entry.EnglishText: No one in Kyogen fights because everyone's rich.

Entry.JapaneseText: 他の街の人たちもみんな、 お金持ちになればいいのにね！
Entry.EnglishText: I wish everyone else in other towns had money too!

Entry.JapaneseText: この音はさ、いくら払ったら 止められるのかなぁ？
Entry.EnglishText: How much do I have to pay this sound to make it stop?

Entry.JapaneseText: ５００００ガルドだったら ボクが軽く払ってあげるのにな。
Entry.EnglishText: I hope 50,000 Gald is enough. That's my pocket money.

Entry.JapaneseText: バ、バイラスに…… いくらあげたらおそわれずに すむのかな……!?
Entry.EnglishText: H-How much do I have to pay for th-those Biruses to go away!?

Entry.JapaneseText: お金ってべんりだよね。 ちょっと払えば、みんな なんでもやってくれるもんね。
Entry.EnglishText: Money really is useful. People will do whatever you want for the right price.

Entry.JapaneseText: 知りたい事があるなら、 物知りじいさんに聞くがいい。
Entry.EnglishText: If there's something you need to know, I think you should ask the Wise Old Man.

Entry.JapaneseText: 向こうの橋を渡ったところに 住んどるよ。
Entry.EnglishText: He lives just beyond the bridge.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Cyan>幻の庭<White>を探しとる人？
Entry.EnglishText: Someone who's searching for the <Cyan>Garden of Illusions<White>?

Entry.JapaneseText: そう言えば、そんな事を聞きに来た 暑苦しい格好の人がおったのう……
Entry.EnglishText: Hmm... I believe someone wearing unbelievably hot clothes came by and asked me about that...

Entry.JapaneseText: ワン・ギンか…… 確かに金は持っとるが、 いけすかんヤツだ。
Entry.EnglishText: It's true that Wan Gin does possess money, but... He's a no-good scumbag.

Entry.JapaneseText: 金をチラつかせて、この地方を 管轄する役人をたらしこんだとか。
Entry.EnglishText: He flashes around his money, and has this town's government under his thumb.

Entry.JapaneseText: おかげでヤツのやりたい放題。 まったく気分悪い話だ……
Entry.EnglishText: Thanks to that, he can do anything he wants. It makes me sick...

Entry.JapaneseText: オークション…… 実に楽しみだ……
Entry.EnglishText: An auction... Honestly, I can't wait...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ワン・ギンは気に食わんが オークションは楽しいからのう……
Entry.EnglishText: I don't really like Wan Gin, but I can't wait for the auction...

Entry.JapaneseText: あの競り落とせるかどうかの スリルがたまらんのだよ……
Entry.EnglishText: I live for the thrill of the auction...

Entry.JapaneseText: フランツという冒険家なら、 この前、一度街に戻って 来とったようだが……
Entry.EnglishText: An adventurer called Franz returned to town the other day...

Entry.JapaneseText: でも、すぐに出て行ったよ。 確か、ノルゼンへ行くとかなんとか 言っとったが……
Entry.EnglishText: But he left immediately after. I think he said something about heading to Nolzen...

Entry.JapaneseText: この音、耳センしてても 聞こえて来る……ううむ。
Entry.EnglishText: This sound... I can still hear it even if I cover my ears... Ugh...

Entry.JapaneseText: オークションに、 「どんな音も消す耳セン」が 出たらイイ値がつくだろうなぁ。
Entry.EnglishText: I think earplugs that could block all sound would sell high if they were put on auction.

Entry.JapaneseText: ワン・ギンが盗賊に 襲われたそうだよ。 ふん、ざまあみろ……
Entry.EnglishText: I heard that Wan Gin got attacked by those burglars. Hmph, serves him right...

Entry.JapaneseText: ワン・ギンがよそ者に 殴られたそうだよ。 実に痛快だ……むふ。
Entry.EnglishText: I heard that Wan Gin got beat up by some outsider. Just hearing about it excites me...

Entry.JapaneseText: オークションで、 「ワン・ギンを殴る権利」が出たら いくらだって買うんだがねぇ。
Entry.EnglishText: If the chance to beat up Wan Gin ever comes up in the auction, I'll bid all of my money on it.

Entry.JapaneseText: アガーテ様のお話ねえ…… そう言えば……
Entry.EnglishText: Lady Agarte's speech... Speaking of her...

Entry.JapaneseText: アガーテ様にそっくりな娘が ワン・ギンのところにいたとか。 どういう事なんだか……
Entry.EnglishText: Wan Gin had a girl that looked just like Lady Agarte... What's the meaning of this...?

Entry.JapaneseText: 本当、軍人さんもご苦労だね。 朝昼晩問わず、歩き続けて その先で騒乱鎮圧だなんて。
Entry.EnglishText: I must thank those guards for their splended work. Day in and day out, they patrol the town preventing any trouble.

Entry.JapaneseText: いや、今度は ミナールらしいんだがね。
Entry.EnglishText: Ah-- This time is just like Minal, though...

Entry.JapaneseText: 何を好き好んで軍人になんか なるものかねえ……
Entry.EnglishText: What would you like to do if you were a soldier...?

Entry.JapaneseText: 他の街では争いがひどいらしいな。 オークションに「平和」を出品したら、 イイ値がつくかもしれんなぁ。
Entry.EnglishText: The conflicts in other towns seem to be horrible. I bet it would fetch a high price if "peace" were to come up at the auction.

Entry.JapaneseText: オ、オークションに…… 「バイラスを倒してくれる戦士」が 出る予定はないのかね……!?
Entry.EnglishText: Does the auction not offer a warrior strong enough to chase away the Biruses...?

Entry.JapaneseText: オークションは、実に楽しい。 思いもよらんものが出品されて、 信じられんような値段がつく……
Entry.EnglishText: I'm honestly excited for the auction. The items that appear there and the price they sell for are unbelievable!

Entry.JapaneseText: まあ、お金のない人にとっては 腹立たしいかもしれんがなぁ。 私はお金持ちだよ、むふふ……
Entry.EnglishText: Well, it might be irritating for people who don't have any cash, but not for me! I'm filthy rich, you see... Haha...

Entry.JapaneseText: ワン・ギンの出迎え？ 出直せ。
Entry.EnglishText: Wang Gin sent you to retrieve me? Should have sent someone else.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ガジュマになぞ、 守ってもらいたくはないわ！
Entry.EnglishText: ...I don't want some Gajuma as a bodyguard.

Entry.JapaneseText: わかった。
Entry.EnglishText: Very well.

Entry.JapaneseText: ワン・ギンの出迎えか、ご苦労。 今回の目玉は何だろう…… 楽しみだな……ぬふふふふ……
Entry.EnglishText: Wang Gin sent you to retrieve me? My thanks. I wonder what's going to draw everyone's attention this time. This is going to be good! Hehehe...

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No
